job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for an MLOps Engineer to help streamline our ML development process and accelerate our research teams. You will be working as part of the newly created ML Platform Team, supporting 7+ teams that work "full stack". Our Research Engineers run Ops, Engineering and Science. We have built our own workflow engine. Now we want to streamline the process, adopt the right tools and super-charge the work we are doing., In this position, you will provide support to our R&D Researchers in all aspects of the MLOps lifecycle. You will also help us establish general coding standards when it comes to ML and MLOps. We want you to:
     * Assist R&D Researchers with fixing issues with their current setups (this includes troubleshooting, integrating CI/CD etc.).
     * Help define our "1 click process" to create custom services and data-pipelines.
     * Implement new tooling in the areas of orchestration, experiment tracking, service deployment, Infrastructure as Code.
     * Conduct research & implement ways to improve standardisation of environments across R&D Teams.
     * Create / Improve infrastructure for Github Actions.
     * Improve Template capabilities - you will be in charge of our basic ML repository.
job_details.full_text:
MLOps Engineer

We are looking for an MLOps Engineer to help streamline our ML development process and accelerate our research teams. You will be working as part of the newly created ML Platform Team, supporting 7+ teams that work "full stack". Our Research Engineers run Ops, Engineering and Science. We have built our own workflow engine. Now we want to streamline the process, adopt the right tools and super-charge the work we are doing., In this position, you will provide support to our R&D Researchers in all aspects of the MLOps lifecycle. You will also help us establish general coding standards when it comes to ML and MLOps. We want you to:
     * Assist R&D Researchers with fixing issues with their current setups (this includes troubleshooting, integrating CI/CD etc.).
     * Help define our "1 click process" to create custom services and data-pipelines.
     * Implement new tooling in the areas of orchestration, experiment tracking, service deployment, Infrastructure as Code.
     * Conduct research & implement ways to improve standardisation of environments across R&D Teams.
     * Create / Improve infrastructure for Github Actions.
     * Improve Template capabilities - you will be in charge of our basic ML repository.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description heavily emphasizes MLOps, streamlining ML development processes, supporting research teams, and establishing coding standards for ML and MLOps. While it mentions supporting 'full stack' teams, the core responsibilities revolve around the ML lifecycle, including troubleshooting, CI/CD integration, defining automated processes for services and data pipelines, implementing tooling for orchestration, experiment tracking, deployment, and Infrastructure as Code. The focus on building and improving infrastructure for ML workflows, experiment tracking, and repository templates aligns directly with the 'ML Engineer' profile, particularly its emphasis on MLOps and productionizing models.

job_tasks.justification: The job explicitly states 'MLOps Engineer' and details responsibilities like 'streamline our ML development process', 'supporting 7+ teams that work "full stack"', 'support to our R&D Researchers in all aspects of the MLOps lifecycle', 'establish general coding standards when it comes to ML and MLOps', 'fixing issues with their current setups (this includes troubleshooting, integrating CI/CD etc.)', 'define our "1 click process" to create custom services and data-pipelines', 'Implement new tooling in the areas of orchestration, experiment tracking, service deployment, Infrastructure as Code', 'standardisation of environments', and 'Create / Improve infrastructure for Github Actions', 'Improve Template capabilities - you will be in charge of our basic ML repository'.
The core of the role is to streamline the ML development process and accelerate research teams, which directly falls under MLOps.
Supporting teams in the MLOps lifecycle is a key responsibility.
